thread.title: Ole Miss at Memphis by the numbers: Unique game in series' history
thread.title_full: Ole Miss at Memphis by the numbers: Unique game in series' history

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Ole Miss at Memphis by the numbers: Unique game in series' history
text:
No. 13 Ole Miss (5-1) at Memphis (5-0) 
11 a.m. CDT Saturday (ABC) 
Liberty Bowl Memorial Stadium, Memphis, Tenn. 
2 Previous Memphis teams have started the season by winning their first five games. The 1938 and 1961 Tigers also won their sixth games of the season. 
3 Games with at least 50 points scored by Ole Miss this season after the Rebels routed New Mexico State 52-3 last week. Ole Miss had never had more than two 50-point games in a season until 2015. The Rebels defeated UT Martin 76-3 on Sept. 5 and Fresno State 73-21 on Sept. 12. 
4 Games with at least 300 passing yards have been posted by Ole Miss QB Chad Kelly in 2015, tied for the school record for the most in a season, after he had 384 passing yards, including 310 in the first half, against New Mexico State last week. Eli Manning threw for 300 yards in four games in both the 2002 and 2003 seasons and Bo Wallace threw for 300 yards in four games in both the 2013 and 2014 seasons. 
6 Consecutive victories for Ole Miss in games against Memphis. The Rebels lead the series with the Tigers 48-10-2. 
12 Consecutive games have been won by Memphis, the longest winning streak in the Tigers' history. Memphis' winning streak is the third-longest in the nation behind Ohio State's 19 and TCU's 14. 
12 Consecutive losses for Memphis against SEC opponents. The Tigers' most recently defeated an SEC member on Sept. 4, 2004, when they beat Ole Miss 20-13. 
FOR MORE OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE SEC, GO TO OUR SEC PAGE 
14 Consecutive losses for Memphis against ranked opponents. The Tigers haven't beaten a ranked opponent since upending No. 6 Tennessee 21-17 on Nov. 9, 1996. Memphis has never beaten a ranked Ole Miss team, although the Tigers played the No. 2 Rebels to a 0-0 tie in 1963. 
24 Consecutive AP polls have included Ole Miss, which is No. 13 in this week's rankings. The Rebels have only one poll streak longer than the current one. Ole Miss was ranked in 73 consecutive polls from 1957 through 1963. 
28 Consecutive games with a pass reception for Ole Miss WR Laquon Treadwell. He's caught a pass in every game that he's played for the Rebels. Treadwell's streak is the longest in the SEC. 
47 Receiving yards needed by Evan Engram to set an Ole Miss record for tight ends. Jim Poole (1969-1971) holds the Rebels' record for most receiving yards by a tight end with 1,113. 
61 Meetings between Ole Miss and Memphis when the teams square off on Saturday, and this year's game will be the first in which the Tigers are ranked when taking on the Rebels. Memphis is No. 22 in this week's coaches poll. Ole Miss is ranked No. 12 in the coaches poll and No. 13 in the AP poll this week. Saturday's game will be the first in Memphis history involving two ranked teams. 
93 All-purpose yards are needed by Jaylen Walton to become the third Ole Miss player with 4,000. Walton would join Deuce McAllister (1997-2000) and Dexter McCluster (2006-2009) as the only Rebels with 4,000 career all-purpose yards. McAllister had 4,889 all-purpose yards, and McCluster had 4,089. Walton holds the Ole Miss record for career kickoff-return yards with 1,754 yards. 
94.6 Points is the combined per-game scoring average of Ole Miss and Memphis, which square off on Saturday. Memphis ranks fourth nationally with a scoring average of 47.8 per game. Ole Miss is fifth at 46.8. Each team has scored more than 50 points in a game three times this season. Memphis' 239 points this season are more than the Tigers have scored in any five consecutive games in school history.
